alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 8:52PM CDT until April 21 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Flooding is expected on the Sucarnoochee River and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Monday afternoon, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River At Livingston. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding of farm lands around Livingston occurs. At 21.0 feet, Overflow of low-lying agricultural lands increases. Cattle and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Monday morning to a crest of 19.7 feet Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
